fields.name: Half bust
fields.description: Imitate the pose of a series of works of art. You will find only half-bust works.

The Lady with an Ermine is a portrait painting widely attributed to the Italian Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci. Dated to c.1489-1491, the work is painted in oils on a panel of walnut wood. Its subject is Cecilia Gallerani, a mistress of Ludovico Sforza, Duke of Milan
Bacchus is a painting made between 1596 and 1598 by the Italian painter Caravaggio, preserved in the Uffizi Gallery in Florence.
St. John the Baptist is an oil painting on walnut panel (69x57 cm) by Leonardo da Vinci, dated 1508-1513 and kept in the Louvre Museum in Paris.
The Mona Lisa, is an oil painting on poplar wood panel by Leonardo da Vinci (77×53 cm and 13 mm thick), dating from around 1503-1506 and housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

fields.name: Full figure
fields.description: Imitate the pose of a series of works of art. You will find only full bust works.

The Aphrodite of Capua is a Roman marble sculpture dating from around the 2nd century AD and housed in the National Archaeological Museum in Naples. The work is a Roman copy of a 4th century BC bronze original.

David is a masterpiece of Renaissance sculpture, created in marble between 1501 and 1504 by the Italian artist Michelangelo. David is a 5.17-metre marble statue of the Biblical figure David, a favoured subject in the art of Florence

The Birth of Venus is a tempera painting on linen canvas (172.5 cm × 278.50 cm) by Sandro Botticelli. Painted for the Medici villa of Castello, the work is currently housed in the Uffizi Gallery in Florence.

The Bacchus on an Earlier Saint John the Baptist is an oil painting on panel transported on canvas (177 × 115 cm) attributed to Leonardo da Vinci and workshop, dated 1510-1515 and kept in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

The Statue of Liberty, whose full name is Liberty Enlightening the World, unveiled in 1886, is a symbol of the entire United States of America. It stands at the harbour entrance on the Hudson River in the middle of Manhattan Bay, on Liberty Island.

fields.name: Mixed
fields.description: Imitate the pose of a series of works of art. You will find half bust and full bust works

The Statue of Liberty, whose full name is Liberty Enlightening the World, unveiled in 1886, is a symbol of the entire United States of America. It stands at the harbour entrance on the Hudson River in the middle of Manhattan Bay, on Liberty Island.
